title: nipples
body:
The small projection of the mammary gland on the [[breasts]] (and male pectorals).

This tag should only be used when the nipples themselves are visible. If they are only noticeable through clothing by way of being erect, use [[covered nipples]] instead. The only time both can apply is when the clothing is [[see-through clothes|see-through]].

title: hiryuu_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Hiryuu[/i]. Character design by [[shibafu_(glock23)|Shibafu]], voiced by [[Uesaka Sumire]]. 

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]], [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. As she was initially designed as Souryuu's sister, she shares the same kimono-and-skirt outfit, but with a different color: hers is [[yellow kimono|yellow]] and [[green skirt|green]]. Common attributes are the [[wide sleeves]], [[white socks]], [[rudder footwear|rudder]] [[sandals]], [[yugake]], and flight deck apron with her hull identifier "Hi" inscribed. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of a [[quiver]] to her back and her real-life [[flight deck]] to her left arm.

body:

title: ishigaki_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese escort ship [i]Ishigaki[/i]. Character design by [[Ugume]]. 

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[black hair]] with a pair of [[hair ribbon]]s, and [[purple eyes]]. Her default (and only) outfit is the class' uniform: a [[white shirt]], [[fur-trimmed jacket|fur-trimmed]] [[green jacket]], [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]], [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[loafers]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her funnel and foremast to her back, two hull pieces each containing a 12 cm single gun mount and 25 mm triple [[anti-aircraft gun]]s, and [[depth charge]]s on her ankles.

title: hachijou_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese escort ship [i]Hachijou[/i]. Character design by [[Ugume]].

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[brown hair]] tied by [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]]s, and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit is the class' uniform: a [[white shirt]], [[fur-trimmed jacket|fur-trimmed]] [[green jacket]], [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]], [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white socks]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[mary janes]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her funnel and foremast to her back, two hull pieces each containing a 12 cm single gun mount and 25 mm triple [[anti-aircraft gun]]s, and [[depth charge]]s on her ankles. 

The historical [i]IJN Hachijou[/i] was commissioned in late March 1941, mostly patrolling the northern waters of Japan and escorted convoys. She survived an air attack in July 1944 and went on to survive the war, although she was scrapped in 1948 apparently having sat idle by that time.

title: kunashiri_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese escort ship [i]Kunashiri[/i]. Character design by [[Ugume]], voiced by [[Sasaki Hitomi]]. 

She is portrayed with [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[pink hair]] with [[brown hair|brown]] [[colored tips|tips]] done [[two side up]], and [[orange eyes]]. Her default (and only) outfit is the class' uniform: a [[white shirt]], [[fur-trimmed jacket|fur-trimmed]] [[green jacket]], [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]], [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white pantyhose]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[mary janes]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her funnel and foremast to her back, two hull pieces each containing a 12 cm single gun mount and 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]]s, and [[depth charge]]s on her ankles. 

Sometimes paired with [[Nenohi (kancolle)|]] due to a faux pas that happened when Kunashiri served as a diplomatic escort for the envoy to Russia. She is named after "Kunashir Island":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kunashir_Island ([i]Kunashiri[/i] in Japanese), the southernmost of the Kuril Islands between Hokkaido and Kamchatka and one of four in territorial dispute by Japan and Russia.

title: help:tags
body:
Tags are keywords used to describe [[help:posts|posts]], allowing you to easily search and explore posts based on their content. Consult the [[help:cheatsheet|cheat sheet]] for a full guide on searching posts. See the [[tag groups]] for existing tags.

h4. Tagging guidelines

When you're tagging a post, use the following guidelines:

h6. Replace spaces with underscores

For example, [code]maria-sama ga miteru[/code] becomes [code]maria-sama_ga_miteru[/code]. Spaces are used to separate tags.

h6. Character names

This is somewhat complicated. In general, use whatever order the source material uses. Failing this, use the ordering the character's nationality suggests. This typically means LastName FirstName order for Asian names, and FirstName LastName order for Western names.

But there are exceptions. Some characters use FirstName LastName order despite having Asian-sounding names. [[Subaru Nakajima]] is a good example of this (in all official promotional artwork FirstName LastName order is used). There is nothing we can do but shake our heads.

Some characters have a mixture of Asian and Western names. Refer to the source material for these cases. Failing that, the general rule is, use whatever ordering the character's last name suggests. Asuka Langley Souryuu has a Japanese last name, so it would become [[Souryuu Asuka Langley]]. Akira Ferrari has an Italian last name, so it becomes [[Akira Ferrari]]. But again, there are exceptions to this, like [[Setsuna F. Seiei]].

h6. Full Names

Using full names reduces the chances of collisions.

h6#restrictions. Tag name restrictions

* Must not be blank, i.e. must contain at least one character
* Cannot contain any asterisks ( * ) or commas ( , )
* Cannot begin with a tilde ( ~ ) or dash ( - )
* Cannot begin or end with an underscore ( _ ), or contain consecutive underscores
* Must contain only printable characters
** [code]!"#$%&'()+-./0123456789:;<=>?@ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ[\]^_`abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz{|}~[/code]
* Cannot begin with a metatag and ":"
** Example: [code]pool:test[/code]
** See "List of available metatags":[/wiki_pages/help:cheatsheet.html#dtext-n4]
* "new" and "search" are reserved and cannot be used
* [b]*_(cosplay)[/b] tags must have an existing character tag
** E.g. [b]chen_(cosplay)[/b] must have a [b]chen[/b] tag

h6. Ask

If you're not sure whether a tag is right or wrong, then ask for help in topic #12251 ("How do I tag this?").

h4. Tag categories

There are five types of tags: artist, character, copyright, general, and meta. Artist tags are red, characters are green, copyrights are purple, general tags are blue, and meta tags are orange.

h6. Artist

Artist tags identify the creator of a post. This doesn't mean the creator of the original copyrighted artwork. For example, you wouldn't use the [[Barasui]] tag on a picture of [[Matsuoka Miu]] drawn by [[Naruko Hanaharu]].

Artist names should follow the guidelines in [[howto:romanize]]. Ask in topic #8199 ("Artist tagging help") if you need help creating an artist tag.

h6. Character

Character tags identify the characters in the post. Remember that Danbooru uses LastName_FirstName ordering.

h6. Copyright

Copyright tags identify the anime, manga, game, or novel that the post is associated with. More generally, copyright tags identify the source material that the characters are from.

Copyright tags should not be used for trademarks or brand names. A rule of thumb: if something doesn't have characters, it probably shouldn't be a copyright tag.

h6. [[help:metatags|Meta]]

Meta tags generally describe things beyond the content of the image itself. Examples include [[translated]], [[copyright request]], [[duplicate]], [[image sample]], and [[bad id]].

h6. General

General tags are used for everything else. General tags should objectively describe the contents of the post. Don't use [[tag group:subjective|subjective tags]] which can be biased by personal preferences (e.g. [[cute]] or [[sexy]]), and don't tag things based on outside knowledge rather than what one can see in the post.

h6#changing-tag-categories. Changing tag categories

You can change the category of the tag by prefixing it with [code]artist:[/code], [code]character:[/code], [code]copyright:[/code], [code]meta:[/code], or [code]general:[/code] when tagging a post. For example, tagging a post with [code]artist:sakura[/code] would change the [[sakura]] tag to an artist tag.

 [code]art:[/code], [code]char:[/code], [code]copy:[/code] are shortcuts for these prefixes.

You can also search the "Tags":[/tags] listing and use the "edit" link next to the tag to change its category.

Tags with between 50 and 1000 posts can only have their category changed by Builders. Category changes for above 1000 posts can be done by Admins, though any large changes should be discussed on the forum first. Make a "bulk update request":/bulk_update_requests/new to create a forum topic requesting that a tag category be changed.

h4. See also

* [[howto:tag|How to Tag]]
* [[help:translated_tags|]]
* [[help:tag_aliases]]
* [[help:tag_implications]]

title: fuyutsuki_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Fuyutsuki[/i]. Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Uesaka Sumire]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] done [[one side up]] with a [[hachimaki]] and fire control director, and [[grey eyes]]. Her default outfit, while still based on the original [i]Akizuki-class[/i] template, diverges somewhat from her elder sisters'. It comprises a [[white shirt]] with a [[white sailor collar]], [[grey coat]] worn [[off shoulder]], [[grey necktie]], [[black gloves]], [[grey corset]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[grey thighhighs|grey]] checkered [[argyle thighhighs]], and grey [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her gear is mostly identical to the rest of the [i]Akizuki-class[/i] except that the bow part is straight and only the exterior is clad, showing off the interior skeleton. She has her own pair of [[Chou-10cm-hou-chan (fuyutsuki's)|]]. They are missing their flipper arms, are covered in scars and their eyes are closed, only being opened in her damaged CG, where their eyes are shown to be white on black, with a central pupil and glint design.

title: hatsuharu_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Hatsuharu[/i]. Character design by [[Allenes]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] tied [[two side up]] with blue [[hair ribbon|hair ribbons]] and [[cat ears]] with matching [[cat tail]].

Her default outfit consists of a [[serafuku]]-style [[school uniform]] with a grey sweater over it, a [[black skirt]], a blue coat with cherry blossom print, and black [[thighhighs]]. Her rig consists of a 61 cm triple torpedo mount on her back, reload torpedoes tucked in her coat, and a 12.7 cm twin gun mount Type B as a [[handgun]].

title: hatsuharu_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Hatsuharu[/i]. Character design by [[Ayaki]].

She is portrayed with [[long_hair|long]] [[purple hair]] in a [[ponytail]] tied with [[shide]], [[purple eyes]], and [[hikimayu]] eyebrows. Her default outfit, shared with Nenohi on historical grounds, consists of a [[white dress|white]] [[sailor dress]] with a [[black sailor collar]], [[purple necktie]], [[black gloves]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge to her back, 12.7 cm single and twin gun mounts as [[drone]]s, and a single floating [[headgear]].

title: diego_armando
body:
A character from [[Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney - Trials and Tribulations]]. He appears in case 4 as a defense attorney and [[Mia Fey]]'s assistant. He loves coffee, and refers to women as 'kitten'. Was once Mia's boyfriend.

[spoiler][[Godot (ace attorney)|]]'s true identity.[/spoiler]

Diego has [[black eyes]], [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] and a short [[beard]]. He has two [[earrings]] on his left ear. He usually wears a [[suit]] that consists of a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[red shirt]] with [[long sleeves]], a [[brown vest|beige]] [[pinstripe vest]], a [[black necktie]], [[black pants]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

[b]Japanese Name:[/b] Kaminogi Souryuu (神乃木荘龍 / かみのぎ そうりゅう)

title: nenohi_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Nenohi[/i]. Character design by [[Ayaki]].

She is portrayed with [[long_hair|long]] [[pink hair]] in a [[single braid]], and [[purple eyes]]. Her default outfit, shared with Hatsuharu on historical grounds, consists of a [[white dress|white]] [[sailor dress]] with a [[black sailor collar]], [[red neckerchief]], [[black bodysuit]], [[bike shorts]], [[bandaged leg|bandages]] as improvised socks, and [[black footwear|black]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge to her back, 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on joints attached to the bridge, 12.7 single and twin [[handgun]] mounts, and floating [[headgear]]. 

A very energetic girl, she tends to use her name in a joke. In fact, it's her single gag, characteristic catchphrase and verbal tic in one ("What day is today? Nenohi/New Year's Day!").

h4. Skins

* !post #2082842: Base
* !post #2229892: [[Nenohi (New Year) (Kancolle)|New Year]]

h4. History

The second of the [i]Hatsuharu[/i]-class built, [i]Nenohi[/i] was actually the first launched. Commissioned on the same day as her sister on 30 September 1933, their trials and initial operations revealed severe stability and maneuverability problems arising from IJN specifications to have them carry identical armament to the larger [i]Fubuki[/i]-class on a lighter displacement. These problems forced the pair into a refit that saw their tall bridges, funnels, and masts lowered while one of their three triple torpedo mounts was removed.

At the start of the war, she was assigned with her sisters as Destroyer Division 21 and saw action in the Dutch East Indies and Aleutian campaigns, the latter was where she was sunk by a US submarine on 4 July 1942, with [[Inazuma (Kancolle)|]] rescuing her survivors.

h4. [i]Hatsuharu[/i]-class destroyers

h6. Initial batch

* [[Hatsuharu (Kancolle)|]]
* [b]Nenohi[/b]

h6. [i]Ariake[/i]-subclass

* [[Ariake (Kancolle)|]]
* [[Yuugure (Kancolle)|]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: IJN [i]Nenohi[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_destroyer_Nenohi_(1932)]
other_names: 子日(艦隊これくしょん)

title: hatsushimo_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Hatsushimo[/i]. Character design by [[Yadokari (Migihashi)|Yadokari]].

She is portrayed with [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]] [[low-tied_long_hair|tied low]] and [[red eyes]]. Her default outfit, shared with her sister Wakaba on historical grounds, consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[red necktie]], [[black jacket]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[loafers]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of funnel and foremast to her back, a 12.7 cm single handgun mount on her left, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount on her right, and two 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on the sides of her waist. 

Despite her record as one of the few surviving ships from [[Operation Ten-Gou]] (and the only one who was undamaged), she is also the very last major warship sunk in action during the war. The circumstances of her sinking and the genericness of her design has turned her into the most inconspicuous shipgirl of the game before her second remodel.

title: natsugumo_(kancolle)
body:

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]], [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit is the Fujikawa-design [i]Asashio[/i]-class uniform: a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[plaid bowtie|plaid]] [[yellow bowtie]], [[grey skirt|grey]] [[pleated skirt]] with [[suspenders]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], [[black socks]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge, funnel, and foremast to her back, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]], [[depth charge]]s dangling from her left suspender, and 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]]s on her right leg [[thigh strap]].

title: yuugure_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Yuugure[/i]. Character designed by [[Allenes]], voiced by Asahina Madoka. 

Her base form portrays her with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[cat ears]] (and matching [[cat tail]]), tied [[two side up]]. She wears a white [[serafuku]] with [[black sailor collar]], a [[black skirt]], a pink print coat, red [[wristband|wristbands]] with [[jingle bell|jingle bells]], and white [[thighhighs]]. Her [[rigging]] at base form is minimal, only possessing a 61 cm triple torpedo mount to her back, reload torpedoes tucked in her coat, and a 12.7 cm twin mount Type B as a [[handgun]].

title: michishio_(kancolle)
body:
The personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Michishio[/i] in [[Kantai Collection]]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Miyakawa Wakana]].

She is portrayed with [[medium hair|medium-length]] light [[brown hair]] done [[two side up]] into [[double bun]]s, and [[yellow eyes]]. Her default outfit is the Konishi-design [i]Asashio[/i]-class uniform: a [[short_sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt]], a [[grey skirt]] with [[suspenders]], [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]], and grey-red [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge and foremast to her back, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, and 61 cm quad handheld [[torpedo tubes]].

The historical ship was completed in October 1937 and sunk at Battle of Surigao Strait in October 1944.

title: the_thing
body:
Three film adaptations of "John W. Campbell Jr.'s":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_W._Campbell [[science fiction]] short novel, "'Who Goes There?'":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Who_Goes_There%3F 
The most renowned one is "the second adaptation by John Carpenter.":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Thing_%281982_film%29 
The Japanese translation of the word "Thing" is 物体X ([i]Buttai X[/i], lit. "Thing-X") 

For the Marvel superhero known as The Thing, see [[Ben Grimm]].

h4.List of titles 

* "Who Goes There?":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Who_Goes_There%3F 
** Japanese title: "影が行く":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%BD%B1%E3%81%8C%E8%A1%8C%E3%81%8F 
* "The Thing from Another World":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Thing_from_Another_World 
** Japanese title: "遊星よりの物体X":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%81%8A%E6%98%9F%E3%82%88%E3%82%8A%E3%81%AE%E7%89%A9%E4%BD%93X 
* "(John Carpenter's) The Thing":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Thing_%281982_film%29

* "The Thing (2011)":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Thing_%282011_film%29 
** Japanese title: "遊星からの物体X ファーストコンタクト":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%81%8A%E6%98%9F%E3%81%8B%E3%82%89%E3%81%AE%E7%89%A9%E4%BD%93X_%E3%83%95%E3%82%A1%E3%83%BC%E3%82%B9%E3%83%88%E3%82%B3%E3%83%B3%E3%82%BF%E3%82%AF%E3%83%88

title: lynette_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable character from [[Genshin Impact]].

A young magician who is part of the House of the Hearth with her twin brother, [[Lyney_(genshin_impact)|]], and her adoptive brother [[Freminet_(genshin_impact)|]].

As kids, she and Lyney lived on the streets and did magic tricks to get money, but one day they were adopted by an aristocrat involved in human trafficking, who planned to sell off Lynette. They were rescued by [[Arlecchino_(genshin_impact)|]] and joined the House of the Hearth, thus becoming Fatui spies.

* !post #6458774: Official Artwork

title: cleveland_(road_trip!)_(azur_lane)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|official costume]] of [[Azur Lane]]'s [[Cleveland (azur lane)]], added exclusively to English version as part of the first anniversary celebrations.

In this costume, she wears a [[white coat]] with [[American flag]]-style decorations on the shoulders over a [[blue shirt]] with the partially obscured phrase "Charlie Love Five Five" (i.e. CL-55, Cleveland's hull number). [[black skirt|black]] [[miniskirt]], a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[black thighhighs|black]] [[torn thighhighs|torn thighhigh]], with [[white footwear|white]] [[boots]] and a [[white hat|white]] [[visor cap]]. The skin also features a [[scooter]] with American flag-style markings, a [[fire hydrant]], some [[traffic cone]]s, and several [[road sign]]s including a [[stop sign]], a [[speed limit sign]] and a sign featuring Cleveland's 13 battle stars.

title: anya_melfissa
body:
A [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive Indonesia]]'s [[Holoro|2nd Generation]]. Designed by [[Uekura Eku]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[brown hair]] with a [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] and [[streaked hair|streaks]], [[purple eyes]] in a semi-permanent [[jitome]] with [[no pupils]] and [[short eyebrows]].

Her regular hairstyle with her default costume is a [[two side up]] with [[double-parted bangs|double-parted]] [[center-flap bangs]] with [[drill sidelocks]] and decorated with a kris-shaped [[hairclip]].

While her reference sheet (and later, her 3D model) portray her with [[small breasts]] bordering on a [[flat chest]], the perspective on her default 2D model gives the impression of her having [[large breasts]]. Because of this, her bust size (and her maturity, to some extent) in fanart varies greatly based on each artist's interpretation.

title: beryl_beru
body:
An English-speaking [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]], designed by [[moenaomii (artist)|moenaomii]]. 

Started streaming in December 2022, though his current outfit debuted on January 2025.

A perpetually [[bags under eyes|tired]] and overworked [[demon]] with a [[otoko no ko|feminine appearance]]. Has [[demon horns|horns]] and a [[demon tail|tail]], as well as [[very long hair|long]] [[messy hair|messy]] [[pink hair|pink]] [[two-tone hair|and]] [[black hair]] with [[thick eyebrows]] and [[sharp teeth]]. Works as an intern for a questionable company at very late hours.

Wears an [[off shoulder]] [[oversized clothes|oversized]] [[lab coat]] that [[sleeves past fingers|goes past his hands]], along with a [[turtleneck sweater]] and [[bike shorts|spats]]. Also sports [[asymmetrical legwear|mismatched legwear]], and an [[ID card]] on his chest. Sometimes drinks from a small [[juice box|carton]].

h4. Appearance

title: braw_bro
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] anime TV series from 1979.  

[b]MAN-03 Braw Bro[/b]

The first [[mobile armor]] designed by the Principality of [[Zeon]] to be used exclusively by newtypes. Created by Zeon's "Flanagan Institute", it has the distinction of being the first mobile weapon to be equipped with the psychic communicator "Psycommu" system for piloting the MA and controlling the only weapons that the Braw Bro was equipped with: four wire-guided units mounting two barrel mega particle guns (top and bottom spars) or single mega particle guns (starboard and port spars). 

The Braw Bro was also designed to separate into different blocks, so that any test data could be preserved.

title: dark_knight_(eversoul)
body:
A non-playable Humanlike Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Pyo Yeong-jae (Korean) | Uncredited (Japanese)
[hr]
A rare male Soul, he is a mysterious armor-clad Soul with a deep hatred towards his fellow Souls and especially towards the [[Savior_(eversoul)|]]. He's currently in service of Kayrin Faust, the human Soul Master seeking to end the lives of the Souls and restart humanity's dominance on the Earth they once left behind. It's eventually revealed that [spoiler]his name is Adam, the very first Soul that Dr. Angelica Faust gave physical form and one of two primordial Souls created by the Transcendents to watch over and ensure the world's eternal recurrence alongside his "sibling" [[Eve_(eversoul)|]]. The reason behind the rarity of male Souls is because of Faust reluctantly having to disgrace Adam as a defective Soul as she couldn't find a way to forge data that would obfuscate Adam's innate affinity towards combat. Despite simply delaying the inevitable, Adam accepted his role to be in the shadows, watching over humanity right behind Faust and Eve in its last few years[/spoiler].

His associated Artifact is currently unknown.

title: daphne_(eversoul)
body:
A Fairy-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Yu Yeong (Korean) | [[Iwami Manaka]] (Japanese)
[hr]
Once a statuesque yet simple country bumpkin, she went to Arkenine to work as a blacksmith after the [[Savior_(eversoul)|]] and his retinue once went to her village and saved it from a minor Gate incident. Wanting to be of use to the Savior and his cause, she decided to use her uncanny superhuman strength to both create strong weapons for Solrey's knights and to fight against monsters and protect her allies while wielding her massive warhammer.

Her associated Artifact is [i]"Hephaestus's Hammer":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hephaestus][/i].

title: atago_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Atago[/i]. Character design by [[Mikoto Akemi]], voiced by [[Touyama Nao]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit, shared with her sister Takao on historical grounds, comprises a [[blue hat|blue]] [[beret]], [[blue shirt|blue]] [[dress shirt]], [[white ascot]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[miniskirt]], [[black gloves]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her bridge and funnels wrapped around her waist, and a circular half-rig hull containing three 20.3 cm twin gun mounts.

Her trademark catchphrase is shouting "[[pan-pa-ka-paaan!]]" when changing equipment. She also uses this as her unique greeting in the anime.

body:
An Angel-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Lee Bo-hee (Korean) | Akina (Japanese)
[hr]
A high-ranking member of the Tabrian Empire's Edel Guards, a specialized group of protectors fighting against the Gates, as well as one of Megalopolis Aurelia's high-ranking Seraphim, an elite task force that answers directly to General Chairman [[Larimar_(eversoul)|]]. Behind her perpetual smile is an almighty force to be reckoned with, making her both a trusted ally and a feared adjudicator.

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Mjölnir":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mj%C3%B6lnir][/i].

title: clara_(eversoul)
body:
A Beast-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Kim Ha-ru (Korean) | [[Okasaki Miho]] (Japanese)
[hr]
A sunny dog girl who owns a farm in the outskirts of Arkenine, living together with the sheep rancher [[Lute_(eversoul)|]] and another Soul named Ina. Despite her strange farming style which relates to treating the earth as an actual being, her farm is one of the few farms in the town that can grow very abundant and delicious crops. Her selflessness and kindheartedness also make her one of the most beloved farmers within and outside her community.

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Cornucopia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cornucopia][/i].

title: ashigara_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Ashigara[/i]. Character design by [[Bob (biyonbiyon)|Bob]], voiced by [[Taneda Risa]].

She [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with a white [[hairband]], and [[brown eyes]]. She wears the [i]Myoukou[/i]-class purple [[military uniform]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[pencil skirt]], white [[pantyhose]] and [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two 20.3 cm twin gun mounts on her shoulders, her real-life bridge split across both of her elbow gloves, a third 20.3 cm twin mount on her right glove, and four 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on her waistline and [[thigh strap]]s. 

h4. Skins

* !post #1921435: Base and kai
* !post #1883659: [[Ashigara Kai Ni (Kancolle)|]]
* !post #5762598: [[Ashigara Kai Ni (Kancolle)|]] reference sheet

h4. Personality

Ashigara is a shipgirl well-known for her obsession with victory, almost on a level equivalent to Sendai's obsession with night battles. She is nicknamed [i]Hungry Wolf[/i], which was (allegedly) given during the naval review celebrating King George VI's coronation where she was Japan's representative, with regards to her living conditions, described as "Spartan" compared to those of other navies in attendance. Because of this nickname, it's not uncommon to draw her with [[wolf ears]] and/or [[fangs]].

A running gag portrays her as a "Christmas Cake"; a woman above 25 who for whatever reason is unable to find a candidate for marriage, a reference to her namesake mountain's association with the folk hero Kintaro, who was raised in Mount Ashigara by a Yama-uba: a mountain hag. Like the "Nagamon" meme, this fan-created joke was featured in the anime.

h4. [i]Myoukou[/i]-class heavy cruisers

* [[Ashigara (Black Surge Night)]]

h4. External links

body:

She has [[absurdly_long_hair|absurdly long]] [[black hair]] in a [[side ponytail]], and [[brown eyes]]. She wears the [i]Myoukou[/i]-class purple [[military uniform]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[pencil skirt]], white [[pantyhose]] and [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two 20.3 cm twin gun mounts on her shoulders, her real-life bridge on her left elbow glove, a third 20.3 cm twin mount on her right glove, and four 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on her waistline and [[thigh strap]]s.

Nachi is sometimes depicted as having a hatred or fear of aircraft due to how she was sunk in real-life: an air raid while anchored in Manila in November 1944.

title: wallace_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Wallace[/b] (Japanese: Mikuri) is the Water-type Gym Leader of Sootopolis City, located in the Hoenn region of the [[Pokemon]] franchise. He first appeared in [I][[pokemon_rse|Pokémon Ruby and Pokémon Sapphire]][/I] and his signature Pokémon is [[Milotic]].

In [[Pokemon Emerald]], [spoiler]Wallace is the Hoenn League Champion while his mentor [[Juan_(pokemon)|]] has succeeded him as Gym Leader of Sootopolis City.[/spoiler]

* In [[Pokemon RSE]], Wallace wears an [[aqua shirt]] and [[purple pants]].

* In [[Pokemon Emerald]], Wallace wears a [[white cloak]] with a [[high collar]] over his outfit from Ruby and Sapphire.

* In [[Pokemon ORAS]], Wallace wears a [[white capelet]], an [[aqua vest]], a [[sleeveless_shirt|sleeveless]] [[purple_shirt|purple]] [[skin tight]] [[crop top]], [[white pants]] and several [[bangle]]s.

title: amemiya_nazuna
body:
An [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]], originally debuting as part of [[VShojo]]'s Japanese branch. She was teased during [[kson]]'s VShojo introduction video. She later left VShojo at the end of 2023 to continue her creative endeavors by herself.

She is an amnesiac [[angel]] girl, with a [[broken halo|broken]] [[blue halo]], a [[single wing|single]] [[detached wings|detached]] [[angel wings|angel wing]], [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]] and has [[heterochromia]], with her left eye being [[pink eyes|pink]] and her right eye being [[blue eyes|blue]].

title: kson
body:
A Japanese-American [[real life|live streamer]] and [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]]. Initially an [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]], she joined [[VShojo]] in July 2022.

On October 16th, 2021, she would debut a new VTuber avatar, known as [[Souchou]] (post #4847937), designed by [[yaman]] and Live2D rigging by [[Kanbutsu Himono (artist)|]]. Her original VTuber avatar was known as [[Daikou-chan]] (代行, meaning an agent, proxy, or representative), which she retired on January 18th, 2022, as the service she used to create it, V-Katsu, ceased support and rescinded all rights for user-created models. Aside from Souchou, she also has several other avatar costumes.

Loves [[pizza]] and [[ryuu ga gotoku (series)|Yakuza]], where she would later star in Yakuza 7 and 8 as [[kei (ryuu ga gotoku)|Kei]]. Sometimes referred to as "kumichou" (組長, meaning "boss"; usually in the yakuza sense). kson reached one million YouTube subscribers on 10 November 2021.

h4. Costumes

title: haruka_karibu
body:
A Canadian [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]]. Her fanbase refers to itself as "the cult."

Though originally an [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]], as of December 3rd 2022, she's a member of the VTuber agency [[VShojo]].

Being a [[deer girl|reindeer girl]], she has [[reindeer antlers]], [[deer ears|reindeer ears]] and a [[deer tail|reindeer tail]].

For her default costume, she wears a [[green dress|green]] [[fur-trimmed dress|fur-trimmed]] [[sleeveless dress]] with a [[cleavage cutout]], [[green sleeves|green]] [[detached sleeves]] and [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]].
For her default hairstyle, she has [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]] decorated with [[hair flower|flowers]] and [[green eyes]].

title: shadowless_(girls'_frontline)
body:
A character from [[Girls' Frontline]]. She is a TV news reporter for the German news network Aktuelle Kamera. She is the older sister of Stasi agent [[Light (girls' frontline)|]]. They are at odds with one other, as Shadowless wants to the truth revealed to the German people and wants to keep her brother safe, while Light wants to help the Stasi and their activities in modern East Germany.

title: sword_of_exorcism
body:
Magic [[sword]] used to slay mononoke in [[Mononoke]].

To unsheathe the sword, mononoke's Form (形/katachi - name, shape, physical appearance), Truth (真/makoto - state of being) and Regret (理/kotowari - state of mind) must be known.

Two different swords of exorcism have been shown:
The one held by the [[Kusuriuri (Mononoke)|]] in [[Mononoke]] and [[Ayakashi: Japanese Classic Horror|Ayakashi]] is red and gold with many round embedded jewels. The pommel is a goblin-like head with facial hair. When drawn it has an orange and purple [[energy sword|energy blade]]. Its name is Ri.
The one held by the [[Kusuriuri (Gekijouban Mononoke)|]] in [[Gekijouban Mononoke]] is yellow with a design of purple scales along the grip. The pommel is a dragon-like head with sharp fangs. When drawn it has a black and yellow energy blade. Its name is Kon.

title: monarch_(siren)_(amalee)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of the [[Indie Virtual YouTuber|Indie]] [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] [[Monarch (amalee)|]].

Unlike her other costumes, this costume [[monsterification|changes her into]] a [[mermaid]] with [[fins]] on her hips [[head fins|and head]], a [[blue bikini|light blue]] [[bikini top only|bikini top]],

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in his costume, she has [[wavy hair|wavier hair]] [[very long hair|reaching down to her hips]] and [[long fingernails|long]] [[blue nails]]. She also wears numerous [[chain]]s, [[jewelry|jewels]] and [[necklace]]s, [[blue butterfly|blue butterflies]] as [[earrings]] as well as on her chest and back, and a [[dagger]] as an accessory on her left hip.

h4. Appearance

title: monarch_(flame_empress)_(amalee)
body:
The 2nd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of the [[Indie Virtual YouTuber|Indie]] [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] [[Monarch (amalee)|]].

Going for a more regal flame motif, this costume consists of a [[blue dress|blue]], [[backless dress|backless]] [[long dress|floor-length dress]] with [[long sleeves]] and [[shoulder spikes]], a fire-shaped [[center opening]], a [[cross-laced slit]] underneath and a [[side slit|second on the right hip]], and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[high heels]] much like on her first costume. She also has [[blue earrings|blue]] [[butterfly earrings]], and a second [[flaming halo]] along with her original [[halo behind head|vertical one]].

It consists of a [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[white jacket]], [[blue scales]] covering her breasts and extending down to her hips, [[white pants|white]] [[skinny jeans]] with a [[locket]] attached to her left hip, [[blue footwear|blue]] [[high heels]] with [[butterfly wings]] on the back and a [[blue cape|blue]], floor-length cape [[wing cape|patterned like butterfly wings]]. She also has [[hoop earrings]], a [[blue brooch]] and [[gold necklace]]s attached to a [[white choker]], and a [[blue halo]] surrounded by crystals [[halo behind head|positioned behind her head]].

title: giselle_gewelle
body:
[[Bleach]] character.

Giselle Gewelle (ジゼル・ジュエル) is a [[Quincy (bleach)|]] and a member of the [[Wandenreich]]'s [[Sternritter]] with the designation "Z - The Zombie," which gives him the ability to [[zombification|zombify]] anyone who comes in contact with his blood.

Despite acting in a ditzy manner, in reality Giselle is cruel and extremely sadistic, as shown by the way he treats [spoilers][[Bambietta Basterbine]][/spoilers] after zombifying her.

Although Giselle is often referred to as a girl, he is a biological male (and should be tagged as such).

title: fo-12_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[Fostech Origin 12]] [[shotgun]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

Quirky and mischievous, she once belonged to the ELID Disaster Alleviation Organization and worked as a searcher and bodyguard. Her partner "Jack the Lightning" is a search dog who acts as FO-12's eyes and provides intelligence in places out of her reach. She doesn't see Jack as a pet, but as a comrade. Due to her previous job, she enjoys hanging out with SG T-Dolls with high defensive capabilities. She especially likes asking Jack to test the durability of their shields, causing many of them to beat tooth marks.

Voiced by [[Shimoda Asami]] and illustrated by [[Bahao Diqiu]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #4922641

h4. See also

* [[List of Girls' Frontline characters]]

h4. External links

* "IOP Wiki: FO-12":[https://iopwiki.com/wiki/FO-12]
other_names: FO-12(ドールズフロントライン)

title: m26-mass_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[M26-MASS]] [[shotgun]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

A lively, sweet girl of [[petite]] stature, she is exceptionally skilled at making modifications and provisioning different [[ammunition]] depending on the nature of a mission. She is the kind that always has a solution to any problem in her team. Naturally very sociable, she loves roughhousing and would sometimes disregard one's personal space, much to others' exasperation. She is also a fan of [[fruit]] on [[pizza]].

Voiced by [[Yuzuki Ryouka]] and illustrated by [[km2o4]].

h4. Appearance

title: dp-12_(girls'_frontline)
body:
[[Girls' Frontline]] representative of the [[standard manufacturing dp-12|DP-12]] double-barreled shotgun manufactured by Standard Manufacturing.

DP-12 is characterized with [[blue hair]], [[grey eyes]], and [[large breasts]].

[[KSVK (girls' frontline)|]] is her adoptive daughter. Initially this was only according to their artist [[Pandea Work]], but was made canon in KSVK's [[KSVK (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]] story, itself an adapted version of Pandea's original concept for their shared backstory. Prior to becoming DP-12, she was known as Helena. Would receive a [[DP-12 (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]].

title: ultima
body:
A series of fantasy role-playing video games made by Origin Systems, not to be confused with the similarly named [[Final Fantasy]] spell or the characters appearing in [[Final Fantasy XVI]] and [[Final Fantasy Tactics]].
The early Ultima games, along with the [[Wizardry]] series, were among the main inspirations for [[Dragon Quest I]].

h4. Main series
* Ultima I: The First Age of Darkness
* Ultima II: Revenge of the Enchantress
* [[Ultima III: Exodus]], received a [[Famicom]] port retitled [[Ultima Kyoufu no Exodus]].
* Ultima IV: Quest of the Avatar
* Ultima V: Warriors of Destiny
* Ultima VI: The False Prophet
* Ultima VII: The Black Gate
* Ultima VIII: Pagan
* Ultima IX: Ascension

h4. Side games
* Akalabeth: World of Doom (originally a stand-alone game, retroactively titled "Ultima 0")
* [[Ultima Underworld]]
* Ultima Underworld 2
* Ultima VII part 2: Serpent Isle
* [[Ultima Online]]

h4. Links
* "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ultima_(series)
* "Ultima Codex":https://wiki.ultimacodex.com/wiki/Main_Page (fan-made wiki)

title: mag-7_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[MAG-7]] [[shotgun]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

A mischievous and calculating Doll who's one of the best players of FPS games in Griffin. She likes taunting and toying with her enemies both in games and on the battlefield, but when she meets a tough adversary, she'll fight without holding back. She has a mini robot "Ukwulu" that can assist her in combat, but it's more of a gaming buddy.

Voiced by [[Itou Ayasa]] and illustrated by [[Reeh (yukuri130)|]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #4932549

h4. See also

* [[List of Girls' Frontline characters]]

h4. External links

* "IOP Wiki: MAG-7":[https://iopwiki.com/wiki/MAG-7]
other_names: MAG-7(ドールズフロントライン)

title: nova_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[Benelli Nova]] [[shotgun]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

A cheerful and easy-going girl whose candidness can make her come off as a little insensitive. She is an Italian pizza fundamentalist and considers the American pizza the bane of her existence. She once worked as a food delivery person for some time, but she received a lot of complaints from customers who ordered pizza with fruit toppings, so she had no choice but to do something else for a living. She is an extremely skilled roller-skater and travels everywhere on her roller skates. Her speed and respect for safety makes her a trusted member of the Logistics Department.

Voiced by [[Takagi Miyu]] and illustrated by [[AC130]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #4918149

h4. Skins

body:

She has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]], [[red eyes|red]]/[[purple eyes]], and wears a [[white headwear]] and [[black dress]].

A gentle, generous, and very worldly Doll who pushes herself to always do her utmost best and never allows herself to give up halfway through... A habit that has become the cause of her OCD. Today, she's feeling troubled because she's unsure whether her desk is centralized in her room.

title: sophie_rudakova
body:
Sophie Rudakova (AKA "Sonya") is a Russian character created by the artist [[b1-517]].

She is a veteran Russian female solider who has been fighting since the beginning of the invasion in 2022. She holds the rank of sergeant major and belongs to the 1st Independent Guards Automatic Rifle Battalion participating in the Donetsk Front. Her nickname "Sonya" is a holdover from a time when her name was mistaken due to a paperwork mistake.

title: ls26_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[Lahti-Saloranta M/26]] [[machine gun]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

A serious and responsible Doll who has the tendency to think her way into a blind alley. She may appear rather unfriendly at work, but she actually cherishes her friendships very dearly. She treats the little knick-knacks given to her by her friends as the most precious treasures and takes them with her all the time. Anyone who dares harm her treasures or her friends will suffer her wrath, which shall descend upon them like a volcanic eruption.

Illustrated by [[Silence Girl]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #5072059

h4. See also

* [[List of Girls' Frontline characters]]

h4. External links

* "IOP Wiki: LS26":[https://iopwiki.com/wiki/LS26]
other_names: LS26(ドールズフロントライン)

title: tokoyami_towa_(cyberpunk)
body:
The 5th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Tokoyami Towa]], as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/MegaJujube/status/1681639565243858945] and released on July 19, 2023.

It consists of a [[white tube top]], a [[white shrug|white]] [[turtleneck]] [[hooded shrug|hood]] with a [[demon hood|demon]], a [[chest belt]], [[puffy long sleeves|long, puffy]] [[see-through sleeves]], a pair of [[ski goggles]] [[goggles on head|on her head]], [[white shorts|white]] [[short shorts]] with [[multiple belts]], a [[thigh pouch]] held with a pair of [[thigh strap|straps]], differently-colored [[knee pads]] (purple on her left, green on right), multiple [[bandaid on leg|bandaids]] on her legs, [[grey socks|grey]] [[loose socks]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[roller skates]]. She also has solid [[white wings|white]] [[demon wings]], her [[winged heart tattoo|winged heart]] [[tattoo]] is now on her [[hip tattoo|right hip]] instead of her thigh and has a [[megaphone]] as an optional accessory.

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume:
* [[Very long hair|Very long]] [[pink hair]] with [[white hair|white]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] done in a [[high ponytail]]
* [[Low twintails|Low]] [[low twin braids|twin braids]] from her [[tokoyami towa (school uniform)|school uniform costume]]

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24481628: Profile
* !post #6508638: L2D
other_names: 常闇トワ(サイバーパンク)

title: a-545_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[A-545]] Kord 6P67 [[assault rifle]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

A T-Doll made to military standard with outstanding combat and shooting capability. She loves and hates with equal fervor and keeps her work and personal life firmly separate. She takes pride in being an elite T-Doll and considers herself a born leader. She treats her subordinates kindly and proves herself to those who question her ability by demonstrating her strengths. But even when she isn't given a leadership role, she still completes her missions to a soldier's standards. She claims that vodka is the best energy, and any drinks less than 50% ABV is just like water to her. She sticks to a strict routine in her daily life, which revolves around the dormitory, the cafeteria, and club activities. She is devoted to popularizing the Vodka Club, which was founded with the mission to replace drinking water with vodka.

Illustrated by [[Messikid]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #5198810

h4. Skins

* !post #5198817: [[A-545 (Bloom of the Drunken Tea) (girls' frontline)|Bloom of the Drunken Tea]]
* !post #7139654: [[A-545 (Silver Tree's Gratitude) (girls' frontline)|Silver Tree's Gratitude]]
* !post #7433639: [[A-545 (Knight of the Lily) (girls' frontline)|Knight of the Lily]]

h4. See also

* [[List of Girls' Frontline characters]]

* "IOP Wiki: A-545":[https://iopwiki.com/wiki/A-545]

title: zoya_petrovna_vecheslova
body:
[[Original]] character of [[chihuri]]. 28 years old. [[yuri|Dating and living together]] with [[yana_(chihuri)|Yana]]. 

Has [[very long hair|very long]], [[grey hair|grey]] hair that [[gradient hair|turns]] [[black hair|black]] at the bottom with a [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]], [[ear piercing]]s, and [[grey eyes]]. She is usually seen wearing a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[black shirt|black]] [[collared shirt]] with a [[black necktie]], or a [[black sweater|black]] [[turtleneck sweater]], and [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]] [[pantyhose under shorts|over]] a pair of [[black pantyhose]]. When going outside she uses a [[white jacket|white]] [[hooded jacket]] that she usually [[open jacket|leaves open]]. Likes to [[smoking|smoke]] [[cigarette]]s.

Not to be confused with [[ende_(chihuri)]] whose eyes are grey.

h4. Appearence 

* !post #4931018
other_names: ゾーヤ・ペトローヴナ・ヴェチェスロヴァ

title: limbus_company
body:
A South Korean gacha game developed and published by [[Project Moon]] and the third game developed by the studio. 

The game centres around the main protagonist [[Dante (Limbus company)|]], an amnesiac who lost their memories after replacing their head with a prosthetic clock. They're soon recruited as a Manager of Limbus Company, a mysterious and very powerful company dedicated to recovering the Golden Boughs from within the City. The player takes control of 12 main characters referred to as the Sinners, as they travel through the City in the bus Mephistopheles to search for the Golden Boughs whilst facing challenges and adversaries along the way.

h4. See also

* [[E.G.O (project moon)|]]
* [[List of Project Moon characters]]
* [[List of Project Moon identities]]

title: military_dress_uniform
body:
A type of formal [[military uniform]] designed for parade and ceremonial use. They usually have more distinctive designs, that show various [[insignia]]s and other decorations or awards like [[medal]]s or [[ribbon bar]]s. As dress uniforms exist for both officers and enlisted personnel, they will also very clearly display the [[military rank insignia]] of the wearer. 

h4. Examples 

* !post #5781548
* !post #6917824: Comparison of [[military fatigues]] and dress uniform.

title: ak74m_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[AK-74M]] [[assault rifle]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

Illustrated by [[Yakob Labo]], she was originally a fan-made doll ({{pixiv:79784298}}). Over the near two years she had existed, she grew in popularity further and further, until finally, out of the blue, it was revealed that she would end up joining the game as a 4* AR.

A standoffish rationalist who hates bright colors, especially on enemies. She makes a clear distinction between her work and personal life. She is a terrific partner in battle, but maintains a strong social boundary with others off the battlefield. Still, she never refuses to help those who need a listening ear.

The story takes place seven years before the original manga. It was followed by two sequels, [[Saint Seiya: Episode.G Assassin]] and Saint Seiya: Episode.G Requiem.

title: force-feeding
body:
[[Feeding]] someone against their will. Usually involves holding the victim's mouth open, [[restrained|restraining]] them, and the victim showing signs of distress. 
Sometimes, the victim is being force-fed more food than they can handle, the wrong kind of food, or things that are no food at all.

h4.See also

* [[tag group:food tags]]

title: silkpunk
body:
A [[science fiction]] genre influenced by Asian-Pacific culture and "punk"-type genres, like [[cyberpunk]] and [[steampunk]]. 

Initially coined by writer Ken Liu to describe his series, "Dandelion Dynasty", it mixes the aesthetics of Asian-Pacific culture and the themes commonly found in genres like steampunk.

For an post to qualify, it should feature enough East Asian elements, while still being science fiction.

h4. External links
* "Ken Liu, Writer - What is “Silkpunk”?":https://kenliu.name/books/what-is-silkpunk/

title: league_of_legends
body:
An American [[defense of the ancients|DotA]]-inspired MOBA (Multiplayer Online Battle Arena) game developed by [i]Riot Games[/i]. Being one of the most popular games in the world.

The game is best known for its deep characterization of each character (called "Champion" in-game), including their in-game skins which typically presents an [[alternate universe]] version of the character with their own storylines.

Due to its popularity, the game has become one of the pioneers of the eSport industry as well as spawning several spin-off multimedia projects, such as an animated series and music videos.

The playerbase is somewhat notorious for being extremely toxic.

h4. See also

* [[Arcane: League of Legends]]

title: peace_symbol
body:
The ☮ symbol, commonly known as the peace symbol.

Originally designed for the British nuclear disarmament movement by Gerald Holtom in 1958, it took on a more generic association with peace in general after being made into badges that were sold in the millions on American campuses. 

For the hand sign with the index and middle fingers raised, see [[V]].

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Symbols]]

title: hongbao
body:
A [[money|monetary]] [[gift]] given in Chinese and other Asian societies, usually during holidays (especially [[Chinese New Year]]) or on special occasions, such as births or weddings. Often presented in a small decorative envelope, often in a red color with a gold accent, symbolizing luck and wealth and prompting its common English name of the "red envelope". It may be depicted in artwork as a symbol of good fortune, prosperity, or festive themes. It could be shown being exchanged between characters, held in their hands, or featured as part of a cultural or holiday-themed scene.

The Chinese character 福 (fortune) is often found on the front of a hongbao. Other characters that may appear include 囍, 財, 賀 and 春. Occasionally some of these characters can be found upside down as a play on the word "to arrive" (pronounced the same as "upside down"). Characters are almost always written in [[Traditional Chinese text|Traditional Chinese]] for aesthetic reasons.

Despite the name, the "red envelope" can be found in other colors such as gold (second most common color) or pink. Whites and blacks are avoided as predominant colors though, as these are considered funeral colors.

Mandarin: 紅包 (Traditional) / 红包 (Simplified) ([i]Hong-Bao[/i])
Min Nan/Hokkien: 紅包 ([i]Ang-Pow or Ang-Pao[/i])
Cantonese: 利事 ([i]Lai-See[/i])

h4. Examples

* !post #3787016: Multiple different designs and common Chinese characters
* !post #1357930
* !post #4353727

h4. See also

* [[Chinese New Year]]
* [[otoshidama]] [tn]Japanese equivalent. Often white.[/tn]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Red envelope":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_envelope]

title: phoenix_ikki
body:
One of the main five Bronze Saints in Saint Seiya.
Like the other four Bronze Saints, he along with 99 other orphans was kidnapped as a child by the Graad Foundation and sent across the world in order to undergo hellish training for seven years and return as a Saint.

In Ikki's case, he was sent to one of the most dangerous training sites of all, Death Queen Island. His time on the island drove him insane and when he returned as the Phoenix Saint, he wanted nothing more than destroy the Graad Foundation and its surviving Saints. 

Following their fight within the inner recesses of Mount Fuji, he exhibits a change of heart upon being defeated by [[pegasus_seiya|Seiya]] shortly before dying in the ensuing cave-in.
 
[Spoiler]It's later revealed he survived due to the Phoenix Saint's resurrective properties. From then on, he becomes an occasional ally of [[Athena_(saint_seiya)|Athena]] and her Saints.[/Spoiler]

He is protective of his younger brother, [[andromeda_shun|Shun]].

Initially voiced by Hideyuki Hori from 1986-2004 in Japan, then [[konishi_katsuyuki|Katsuyuki Konishi]] from 2005 till date.

title: sakawa_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Sakawa[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Yamada Yuuki (voice actor)|]].

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[purple hair]] with [[antenna hair]], and light [[purple eyes]]. Her default outfit is the class' uniform: a white [[serafuku]] that exposes her [[midriff]] with a red [[pleated skirt]], [[blue necktie]], [[white gloves]], [[belt]], [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]], and has [[uneven legwear]] where the left leg is a [[single thighhigh]] with a [[garter_straps|garter strap]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge, funnel, and mast (with [[radar]]) worn in a backpack-like arrangement, her three 15.2 cm twin gun mounts controlled by [[joystick]]s, an 8 cm twin [[anti-aircraft gun]] mount on her right ankle, and a [[flight deck]] and 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on her left leg. 

Sakawa is visibly shorter, thinner and has [[small breasts]]: the result of having never participated in combat because the IJN was short of fuel (in fact, this was what prevented her and the other surviving [i]Akizuki[/i]-class destroyers under her DesRon from joining her sister Yahagi in Operation Ten-Go). 

h4. Skins

* !post #2082887: Base
* !post #3355997: [[Sakawa (christmas) (kancolle)|Christmas]]
* !post #4301293: [[Sakawa (Lawson) (kancolle)|Lawson collab/winter]]

h4. History
Due to her being commissioned late in the war and her inability to participate in [[Operation Ten-Gou]], her only claim to fame is being used as a target for [[Operation Crossroads]] at Bikini Atoll in 1946 with several other ships, being sunk in the first [i]Able[/i] detonation.

title: kinu_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Kinu[/i]. Character design by [[Werkbau]], voiced by [[Yahagi Sayuri]]. Released in the [i]Swirling Cherry Blossoms[/i] event of December 2019 along with her retrofit.

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] and [[yellow eyes]] and [[small horns|small]] [[red horns]]. Her default outfit consists of a black IJN [[military uniform]] with a [[black cape]] with [[red cape|red inner layer]], black [[peaked cap]], black [[kneehighs]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white gloves]], and [[shoulder armor]] with [[fake horns]] attached.

Her base form rig consists only of her two hull pieces each with their own 14 cm single mount and a pair of 61 cm [[torpedo tubes]] on her left waist, while she uses a [[katana]] as her melee weapon. For her retrofit, see [[Kinu (retrofit) (azur lane)|the corresponding page]].

title: claire_(eversoul)
body:
A Humanlike-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Yi Sae-ah (Korean) | [[Hasegawa Ikumi]] (Japanese)
[hr]
She is the commander of Solrey's Order of Sun, one half of Solrey's knight orders that prioritizes camaraderie and teamwork above all else. She was once an ordinary farmgirl until one fateful day when she awakened her powers while protecting her friends from monsters coming out of the Gates. Since then, she's decided to fight as a paladin in order to find a way to end the Gate incidents for good, but in order for that to become reality, she must first leave behind the life and friends she once knew...

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Flag of Jeanne d'Arc":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joan_of_Arc][/i].

title: chloe_(eversoul)
body:
A Fairy-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Kim Yeon-woo (Korean) | [[Matsuda Satsumi]] (Japanese)
[hr]
The upbeat deputy commander of Solrey's Order of Sun, serving under Commander [[Claire_(eversoul)|]]. She's childhood friends with both fellow Order of Sun knight [[Rose_(eversoul)|]] and the Order of Blackhawk Commander [[Linzy_(eversoul)|]]. She can be a bit of an idiot at times but her loyalty towards both her friends and the citizens of Solrey, as well as her approachable behavior and physical resiliency, make her a very popular knight amongst her peers and the general populace.

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Aegis":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aegis][/i].

title: cherrie_(eversoul)
body:
A Humanlike-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: [[Kang Si-hyeon]] (Korean) | [[Maeda Kaori]] (Japanese)
[hr]
A drunken pirate from Troyca leading the pirate crew known as the Torch Pirates. For some reason though, she feels split in regard to which country she should call "home"... is it Gaon, the land where she first woke up and lived in, or is it Troyca, where she founded her dear pirate crew and her current country of residence?

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Shinpen Kidoku":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shuten-d%C5%8Dji#Three_gods_and_divine_sake][/i].

title: catherine_(eversoul)
body:
A Humanlike-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Lee Ji-yeong (Korean) | [[Nazuka Kaori]] (Japanese)
[hr]
She is both a nun working at Arkenine Cathedral, a church for the Eve Faith, and a knight of Solrey under Commander [[Claire_(eversoul)|]]'s Order of Sun. She is a very gentle and kindhearted nun who always looks out for those in need. She often walks with a [[cane]] in her right hand as she has a prosthetic left leg that needs support. [spoiler]She loses said disability after becoming a Chaotic-type.[/spoiler]

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Holy Shroud":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shroud_of_Turin][/i].

title: bryce_(eversoul)
body:
An Undead-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: [[Heo Yeoeun]] (Korean) | [[Amami Yurina]] (Japanese)
[hr]
The "younger" twin sister of [[Melfice_(eversoul)|]], she is the aloof and refined half of the Tabrian underworld's Twin Executioners. She suffers from a debilitating illness that gradually weakens her physical form up until she succumbs and dies from it regularly, repeating each time she reawakens. Both her and her twin joined Duchess [[Sigrid_(eversoul)|]]'s Nightbloods in order to use her expansive information network to dig up any info for any sort of cure.

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Yagrush":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kothar-wa-Khasis#Baal_Cycle][/i].

title: beleth_(eversoul)
body:
A Humanlike-type Artificial Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Kim Do-hee (Korean) | [[Kino Hina]] (Japanese)
[hr]
The maid-like fifth Ark Operator assigned to pilot and manage the fifth Ark "Zadkiel":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zadkiel], the ark that held human civilians and non-combatants. She ultimately failed in her task as the populace inside the spaceship fell into despair upon the failure of the cryosleep systems within, slowly dying out within a single millennium. Once lost in space, she returned to Earth -- now Eden -- upon receiving Operator One [[Mephistopheles_(eversoul)|]]'s distress signal in order to take over as the [[Savior_(eversoul)|]]'s trusted assistant. [spoiler]Her programmed priority towards humans over her own kind does put her at odds with some of the Souls in Eden though, as she also tended to assist Kayrin Faust, the mastermind behind Eden's plight, and her party as well before the Savior gave her the command to be "his maid alone."[/spoiler]

title: ayame_(eversoul)
body:
A Demon-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: [[Jang Ye-na]] (Korean) | [[Shitaya Noriko]] (Japanese)
[hr]
She is a trusted retainer of the Gaon warlord [[Sakuyo_(eversoul)|]], though her shy and panicky disposition may think one otherwise. She has the power of [[umbrakinesis]] and has a more assertive and violent split personality aptly named "Another Ayame."

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Mirror of Tsukuyomi":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tsukuyomi-no-Mikoto][/i].

title: aki_(eversoul)
body:
A Humanlike-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: [[Park Ji-yoon]] (Korean) | [[Hondo Kaede]] (Japanese)
[hr]
A wandering swordswoman from Gaon who's taken it upon herself to start a handyman service named "Wandering Troubleshooter" alongside her catgirl ninja companion [[Ruri_(eversoul)|]]. The reason for her endless wandering is much darker than one would expect though...

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Muramasa":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Muramasa][/i]. [spoiler]She is also one of three currently playable Souls who's actually created from a fusion of multiple ANIMA taken from Artifacts bearing the same name, alongside [[Flynn_(eversoul)|]] and [[Nini_(eversoul)|]].[/spoiler]

title: aira_(eversoul)
body:
A Beast-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Jung Hye-won (Korean) | [[Watada Misaki]] (Japanese)
[hr]
She is a feral lion girl with power over life and death, though she seems to take interest in whatever her primal instincts dictate her to desire more. She is on the Gates' side due to her undying loyalty to "the witch" [[Vivienne_(eversoul)|]], who apparently saved her from an eternal life bound to chains.

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Dagda's Club":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Dagda][/i].

title: adrianne_(eversoul)
body:
An Angel-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: [[Lee Myeong-ho]] (Korean) | [[Kitamura Eri]] (Japanese)
[hr]

She is a soldier for the Tabrian Empire's Edel Guards, a specialized group of protectors fighting against the Gates. Her upbeat and go-getting attitude masks her intense drive to close the Gates and regain world peace for all, even if it means laying down her whole existence to make it happen.

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Ascalon":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saint_George[/i].

body:
A playable operator in [[arknights:_endfield|Arknights: Endfield]].

[quote]
Perlica is the Supervisor of Endfield Industries and the official spokesperson of the company. Her roles include promoting the development and applications of Techno-Protocol and managing the ship Dijiang.

She is capable of responding to various crises in a calm and decisive manner. However, Endfield often faces challenges that go beyond their expectations. Perlica often has to move between bases and outposts, doing whatever she can to maintain order and keep things running.

title: mass-produced_nikke
body:
Characters from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]].

A collective term used to refer to Nikkes that are mass-produced by the Big Three of the Ark, hence the name. Gameplay-wise, mass-produced Nikkes make up the R rarity of the Nikkes. There are numerous Mass-Produced Nikkes introduced in the game, notably the NPC one first introduced in the "Hightech Toy" event which is a generic NPC version introduced in later events.

The NPC version has [[brown hair]] and wears a [[visor]] which conceals their eyes along with [[medium breasts]]. They wear a [[green bodysuit]] with [[high heel boots]] and a pair of [[black gloves]]. They are often seen [[holding weapon|holding a gun]].

body:
????? / Walpurgis no Yoru / Walpurgisnacht / Walpurgis Night

[[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]] character.

An incredibly powerful [[witch (madoka_magica)|]] whose true name is unknown. She appears as a dressed woman standing upside-down on rotating gears. Humans liken her magic to severe weather such as [[tornado|tornadoes]] or hurricanes.

Her [[walpurgisnacht's familiars|familiars]] are also unnamed.

A Japanese packed lunch. A traditional bento consists of [[rice]], [[fish]] or [[meat]] (or [[tako-san wiener]]), [[tamagoyaki]], and one or more pickled or cooked vegetables, usually in a box-shaped container, and sometimes wrapped in a cloth known as a [[furoshiki]] or stacked together.

title: jimiko
body:
[b]Jimiko[/b] (地味子, lit. "sober" or "quiet girl") is a term used to describe a female character with a plain (not necessarily homely), mousy, or unassuming appearance and/or personality or demeanor.

[[Glasses]], [[messy hair|messy]] or [[unkempt]] hair, [[thick eyebrows]], [[twintails]] or [[twin braids|braids]], [[freckles]] and [[bags under eyes|baggy eyes]] can all often complete the look.

title: mojyo
body:
A mojyo (喪女,  もじょ, lit. "mourning woman") is a woman who is woefully romantically inept or inexperienced. An equivalent Western term is femcel.

Often gloomy or neurotic, and possibly [[slovenly]] as well, a mojyo may leave their hair [[messy hair|messy]] or [[unkempt]], or be so emotionally strung out as to have a penchant for [[crazy_eyes|crazed]] [[crazy_smile|expressions]].

title: noh_mask
body:
A traditional Japanese theater [[mask]].

[i]Noh[/i] (能) is a classical Japanese form of dance drama. Noh masks are also used in Kyōgen performances (the comedic counterpart to [i]Noh[/i]) and sometimes also in other Japanese performing arts and ceremonies.

Noh masks are traditionally made from carved cypress wood, painted or lacquered. They are frequently affixed by means of a red silk tying cord. They tend to employ heavy emphasis of shadows in order to portray different emotions (which can be changed by angling the mask).

Masks depicting human beings tend to reflect traditional medieval Japanese aesthetics (resembling characters from woodcut prints), having pale 'chubby' faces with well defined brows and cheek lines, plus prominent eyebrows. Masks depicting older humans tend to have extensive wrinkles and beards.

Masks depicting supernatural entities tend to have large eyes and exaggerated expressions. They may also have horns, fangs and other nonhuman features. Gold paint is frequently used to (literally) highlight the otherworldly appearance of such entities.

Noh masks are used to portray different characters when on stage, similar to Western makeup. An actor may, however, rapidly switch between different masks to fulfill different roles.

h4. Examples

* !post #6019523: [[Hannya]] (Female Demon)
* !post #2511142: [[Hyottoko mask]] (Fire God) 
* !post #1445203: [i]"Ko-omote":[https://www.the-noh.com/sub/jp/index.php?mode=db&action=e_view_detail&data_id=23&class_id=1][/i] (Young Woman) 
* !asset #23898113: [[Okina mask]] (Old Man)
* !post #1476066: [[Monkey mask]] (Saru/Monkey Spirit) 
* !post #3620455: [i]"Uba":[https://www.the-noh.com/sub/jp/index.php?mode=db&action=e_view_detail&data_id=32&class_id=1][/i] (Crone) 

h4. See also

* [[Fox mask]] [tn]Sometimes also a noh mask.[/tn]
* [[Hata no Kokoro]]
* [[Menreiki]]

h4. External links

* "The-Noh.com: Introducing the World of Noh":[https://www.the-noh.com/en/world/mask.html]
* "The-Noh.com: Noh Mask Database":[https://www.the-noh.com/sub/jp/index.php?mode=db&action=e_index&class_id=1]
* "Noh-Mask-21.com: Mask List":[https://nohmask21.com/eu/mlist.html]
* "Wikipedia: Noh":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Noh

body:

She is portrayed with [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]], and [[yellow eyes]]. Her default (and only) outfit is the class' uniform: a [[serafuku]] consisting of a [[black shirt]] with [[black sailor collar]], [[crescent pin]] on the sailor collar, [[black skirt]], [[black socks|black kneehighs]], and [[grey footwear|grey shoes]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is shared with the rest of the class: her funnel and a [[depth charge]] to her back, a 12 cm [[handgun]] mount with a shield, and two 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on her ankles. 

She [[name connection|shares the same name]] as [[Mikazuki Munechika]] from [i][[Touken Ranbu]][/i] and, as a result, is often paired with him in various [[crossover]] fanart. Their grouping is tagged "三日月爺孫" ("Mikazuki Grandfather-Daughter") in pixiv, since Mikazuki the sword spirit is a self-proclaimed old man (and thus the grandfather), while his ship-girl counterpart is a very young girl (hence the grand-daughter).

title: goat
body: A hardy domesticated ruminant animal that has backward curving [[horns]] and (in the male) a beard. It is kept for its [[milk]] and [[meat]] and is noted for its lively and frisky behavior.

title: tiger
body:
A member of the Felidae family and the largest and possibly most dangerous of the five "[[tag_group:cats|big cats]]". Native to much of eastern and southern Asia, the Tiger is an apex predator and an obligate carnivore. Aside from their great bulk and power, their most recognisable feature is a pattern of dark vertical stripes that overlays near-white to reddish-orange fur, with lighter underparts.

h4. See also

* [[white tiger]]
* [[tiger lily]]

title: leopard
body:
A large, solitary feline that has a yellowish-brown or brown coat with black spots and usually hunts at night, widespread in the forests of Africa and southern Asia.

Do not confuse with [[leopard cat]]s.

h4. See also

* "Wikipedia page":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leopard]

A small rodent that typically has a pointed snout, rounded ears, and a long scaly tail. This tag includes both smaller mice and larger rats.

For the mouse used with computers, see [[computer mouse]]. For the anime, see [[Mouse (anime)]].

title: satsuki_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Satsuki[/i]. Character design by [[Kusada Souta]], voiced by [[Hidaka Rina]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] in [[twintails]], and [[yellow eyes]]. Her default outfit is the class' uniform: a [[serafuku]] consisting of a [[black shirt]] with [[black sailor collar]], [[crescent pin]] on her [[white necktie]], [[black skirt]], plain [[black thighhighs]], and [[grey footwear|grey shoes]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is shared with the rest of the class: her funnel and foremast to her back, two 12 cm [[handgun]] mounts, and two 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on her ankles.

title: lao_gan_ma
body:
[b]Lao Gan Ma[/b] (Chinese: 老干妈; also called [b]Laoganma[/b]) or [b]Old Godmother[/b] is a popular brand of chili sauce and other condiments originating from [[China]]. 

The brand was founded by Tao Huabi in 1996 and has since gained widespread popularity both in China and internationally. The most famous product is the "Lao Gan Ma Chili Crisp," which is made from chili peppers, soybean oil, fermented soybeans, garlic, and other spices. It has a rich, spicy, and slightly sweet flavor, and is often used as a topping or ingredient in various dishes, such as rice, noodles, and stir-fries. 

The distinctive label features a portrait of Tao Huabi, which has become iconic.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Lao Gan Ma":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lao_Gan_Ma

title: russo-ukrainian_war
body:
A [[war]] between [[Russia]] and [[Ukraine]] that began in February 2014. The conflict has included the following events:

* The 2014 annexation of Crimea
* The Donbas War since 2014
* The 2021 Russian military buildup near the Ukrainian borders
* The 2022 full-scale invasion of Ukraine
* Wagner leader [[Yevgeny Prigozhin]]'s mutiny against the Russian military leadership in June 2023, and subsequent death in August
* The August 2024 surprise incursion of Ukrainian Forces into Kursk Oblast, Russia.
* [[North Korea]] sending their troops in October 2024 at Kursk.

title: the_punisher_(character)
body:
The titular anti-hero from the [[Marvel]] series [[The Punisher (series)|]]. His real name is Franco Castiglione, a.k.a. Frank Castle.

After becoming a civilian just as the Vietnam War ended, Castle lost his family to the mafia, a personal tragedy that turned him into The Punisher. Now he hunts down and kills any type of criminal, mostly those which murder innocent people, regardless of their allegiance.

He is very big, strong and highly lethal and proficient in any type of armed and unarmed combat, very skilled in [[martial arts]] and the use of any kind of weapon, from melee to firearms to heavy weaponry. He also has an almost superhuman level of pain tolerance.

His chest is usually protected by a heavy armored bullet proof [[vest]]. The bright white [[skull]] on his shirt serves both to scare his enemies and to lure their fire into the most heavily protected area of his torso.
other_names: フランク・キャッスル

title: strider_(video_game)
body:
A 1989 side-scrolling platforming action game released for the CP System arcade hardware by [[Capcom]]. The game was designed by Yotsui Kouichi, a.k.a. "Isuke":[http://strider.wikia.com/wiki/Isuke].

It became one of Capcom's early hits before [[Street Fighter II (series)|]], revered for its innovative gameplay, multilingual voice clips during cutscenes (presented in English, Japanese, Chinese, Russian and Spanish) as well as its epic and diverse soundtrack (created by female video game composer "Junko Tamiya":http://capcom.wikia.com/wiki/Junko_Tamiya ).

A [[Sega Mega Drive]]/Sega Genesis port of the  arcade version was released in 1990 and it quickly became one of the best selling and most critically acclaimed videogame adaptations for that system.

A [[NES]] console version of the game was released in the United States only during 1989. This was an RPG, adventure and action adaptation with a plot and characters different from the arcade machine and more related to the Strider manga. 

The manga based on the franchise was released in Japan a whole year before the game, illustrated and written by Tatsumi Wada, and serialized in the monthly magazine [i]Comic Computique[/i] from May to October 1988, spanning six issues. A single volume collection was later published on November 10, 1989. A short prequel story, titled [i]Strider Hiryu Gaiden[/i], was published following the completion of the main series and is not included in the collected edition.

Under license from Capcom USA, U.S. Gold and Tiertex produced a Strider video game sequel in Europe titled [i]Strider II[/i] (released in North America as [i]Journey From Darkness: Strider Returns[/i]) for various computer platforms, as well as the Mega Drive, Game Gear, and Master System. This European produced sequel was never released in Japan.

An unofficial "spiritual" sequel called [[Cannon Dancer]] was created in 1996 by [i]Isuke[/i]. 

Capcom later produced an official video game sequel, unrelated to the Tiertex produced Strider Returns and to Cannon Dancer, titled [i]Strider 2[/i]. It was released for the arcades and the [[PlayStation 1]] in 2000.

A new remake of the first arcade game called [i]"Strider HD":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strider_%282014_video_game%29 [/i] was developed by Californian studio Double Helix Games and Capcom's Osaka studio. It was released in early 2014 for the [[PlayStation 3]], [[PlayStation 4]], [[Xbox 360]], [[Xbox One]] and Windows.

title: rho_aias
body:
[b]Rho Aias: The Seven Rings that Cover the Fiery Heavens[/b] ([[Fate/Stay Night]]) / [b]Seven Rings of Heaven[/b] ([[Fate/Extra]] English localization).

A Conceptual Weapon stored in the Reality Marble [[Unlimited Blade Works (reality Marble)|]] used by [[Archer_(Fate)|]] and [[Emiya Shirou]] in Fate/Stay Night's [[fate/unlimited_blade_works|Unlimited Blade Works]] and [[Heaven's Feel]] routes. Presented as a purple/pink [[energy shield]] composed of seven concentric circular/flower-petal-shaped layers arranged from smallest to largest, with the largest facing the user.

Each layer is as strong as a fortress wall, and the shield as a whole carries the "concept" of "blocking any projectile attack." The Conceptual Weapon is based on Telamonian Ajax's (Ajax the Greater's) shield, which consisted of seven cowhides over a layer of bronze; during the Trojan War (according to the Iliad), the shield blocked all attacks aimed at Ajax and his comrade Teucer without taking damage until it blocked [[Hector_(Fate)|]]'s spear, which pierced the first six layers before being stopped by the seventh. In the Unlimited Blade Works route, [[Cu Chulainn (Fate/Stay Night)|Lancer]] uses [[Gae Bolg (Fate)|]]'s thrown attack to the same effect in his second battle against Archer. [spoiler]During Shirou's battle against [[Gilgamesh_(Fate)|Gilgamesh]], Archer used Rho Aias to protect the former, and in the anime adaptation Shirou is shown using the shield during the battle.[/spoiler] Also, [spoiler]in the Heaven's Feel route, Shirou used the shield against [[Saber Alter]]'s [[Excalibur Morgan_(Fate)|]] in order to protect [[medusa_(fate)|Rider]].[/spoiler]
